subject: Re: [junit] JUnit with Eclipse, error in setUp(), java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache
msgSnippet: ... The problem /isn t/ with JUnit. Something else requires the Apache Commons Collections library, which you can download from
messageBody:
samanthaclark wrote:
> I'm fairly new to Junit, and am using it with Eclipse (on Windows XP).
> I'm having problems running a simple JUnit test case. I have tried
> searching Google and the Eclipse/Junit forums about the problem, but I
> haven't found anything that helps. The code and failure trace are
> copied at the end of this message.
>
> The error occurs in setUp(), when the Network object is instantiated.
> I can't understand why I'm getting the NoClassDefFoundError, because
> the NetworkTest class is in the same directory as the Network class.
> The Network constructor doesn't throw any exceptions, and Network
> doesn't have any static fields.
>
> Does anyone have an idea about what is wrong with the code?
>
> I have tried adding junit.jar and my source files to the Classpath
> (Control Panel -> System -> Advanced -> Environment variables), but it
> didn't fix the problem.
> I tried commenting out setUp() and the body of testGetName(), in which
> case the test passes, so problem appears not to be with Junit itself.

The problem /isn't/ with JUnit. Something else requires the Apache
Commons Collections library, which you can download from
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/collections. Odds are you already have
this in your classpath for the non-test code; you just need to make sure
that it's in the testing classpath.

> CODE:
> public class NetworkTest extends TestCase {
>
> Network testNetwork;
>
> public NetworkTest(String arg0) {
> super(arg0);
> }
>
> protected void setUp() throws Exception {
> super.setUp();
> testNetwork = new Network("testNetwork");
> }
>
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> super.tearDown();
> testNetwork = null;
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(new NetworkTest("testGetName"));
> return suite;
> }
>
> public void testGetName() {
> assertEquals(testNetwork.getName(), "testNetwork");
> }
> }
>
> FAILURE TRACE:
> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/commons/collections/Predicate
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
> at framework.NetworkTest.setUp(NetworkTest.java:17)
